{{Infobox NFL_season | team = Atlanta Falcons | year = 2011 | record = 7â5 | division_place = 2nd [[NFC South]] | coach = [[Mike Smith (American football coach)|Mike Smith]] | owner = [[Arthur Blank]] | stadium = [[Georgia Dome]] | playoffs = TBD | pro bowlers = TBD | uniform = | next = [[2012 Atlanta Falcons season|2012]] }} The '''[[2011 NFL season|2011]] [[Atlanta Falcons]] [[List of Atlanta Falcons seasons|season]]''' will be the franchise's 46th season in the [[National Football League]] and the fourth under head coach [[Mike Smith (American football coach)|Mike Smith]]. After a disappointing loss to the [[Green Bay Packers]] in the divisional round of the [[2010â11 NFL playoffs|playoffs]], the Falcons will attempt to defend its [[NFC South]] division title and contend for another [[Super Bowl]]. {{TOClimit|3}} ==Offseason== Signed LE Ray Edwards to a 5 year deal Cut WR Michael Jenkins and LE Jamaal Anderson ===2011 NFL Draft=== {{main|2011 NFL Draft}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- ! Round !! Selection !! Player !! Position !! College |- ! 1 || 6 | [[Julio Jones]] || [[Wide Receiver]] || [[Alabama]] |- ! 3 || 91 | [[Akeem Dent]] || [[Inside Linebacker]] || [[University of Georgia|Georgia]] |- ! 5 || 158 | [[Jacquizz Rogers]] || [[Running Back]] || [[Oregon State]] |- ! 6 || 192 | [[Matt Bosher]] || [[Punter (football)|Punter]] || [[Miami (FL)]] |- ! 7 || 210 {{ref|Chris Houston trade|[a]}} |[[Andrew Jackson (American football)|Andrew Jackson]] || [[Offensive Guard]] || [[Fresno State]] |- ! 7 || 230 {{ref|Quinn Ojinnaka trade|[b]}} | [[Cliff Matthews (American football)|Cliff Matthews]] || [[Defensive End]] || [[South Carolina]] |} :{{note|Chris Houston trade|[a]}} The Falcons acquired this seventh-round selection and a [[2010 NFL Draft|2010]] sixth-round selection in a trade that sent [[Cornerback|CB]] [[Chris Houston (American football)|Chris Houston]] to the [[Detroit Lions]]. :{{note|Quinn Ojinnaka trade|[b]}} The Falcons acquired this seventh-round selection in a trade that sent [[Offensive tackle|T]] [[Quinn Ojinnaka]] to the [[New England Patriots]]. ==Preseason== ===Schedule=== The Falcons' preseason schedule was announced on April 12, 2011. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 92%;" "align=center" |- ! rowspan="2" | Week !! rowspan="2" | Date !! rowspan="2" | Kickoff !! rowspan="2" | Opponent !! colspan="2" | Results !! rowspan="2" | Game site !! rowspan="2" | TV !! rowspan="2" | NFL.com

ATL â [[Sean Weatherspoon]] â 9 tackles, 1 assist * CHI â [[Brian Urlacher]] â 6 tackles, 2 assists }} The Falcons started their season out on the road against the Bears. With the loss, the team fell to 0-1. ====Week 2: vs. Philadelphia Eagles==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Atlanta Falcons}}; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Atlanta Falcons}};text-align:center; |state=autocollapse |title= Week Two: Philadelphia Eagles at Atlanta Falcons â Game summary |date=September 18 |time=8:20 p.m. EDT |road=Eagles |R1=0|R2=10|R3=21|R4=0 |home='''Falcons''' |H1=7|H2=7|H3=7|H4=14 |stadium=[[Georgia Dome]], [[Atlanta, Georgia]] |attendance=69,608 |weather=Played indoors (dome stadium) |referee=[[Carl Cheffers]] |TV=[[NBC Sunday Night Football|NBC]] |TVAnnouncers=[[Al Michaels]], [[Cris Collinsworth]] and [[Michele Tafoya]] |reference= |scoring= ;First quarter ;Second quarter ;Third quarter ;Fourth quarter |stats= ;Top passers * PHI â [[Michael Vick]] * ATL â [[Matt Ryan]] ;Top rushers * PHI â Lesean McCoy * ATL â [[Michael Turner (American football)|Michael Turner]] ;Top receivers * PHI â [[Jeremy Maclin]] * ATL â [[Tony Gonzalez (wide receiver)|Tony Gonzalez]] ;Top tacklers * PHI â [[Jamar Chaney]] * ATL â [[Sean Weatherspoon]] }} For the regular season opener at home, the Falcons faced the Eagles. The win improved the team to 1-1 and also helped Starting QB Matt Ryan improve to 4-0 as a regular season starter during home games. ====Week 3: at Tampa Bay Buccaneers==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Atlanta Falcons}};
